column4: I get 5 ips from my isp, i get them from a dhcp server and they are all dyn, is there a way under ubuntu that lets be change the ip without changing the mac adress ?
cancel the lease on the IP, if you are allowed that control
all you can do then wthpr0 is release the IP but no guarantees you dont get it right back
the MAC address is a number burned into the NIC permanantly, like a serial number
so dont use DHCP, just hard set to one of the 5 ips?
i don't know what they are, they are dynamic
they are private IPs yes? like 182.168.0.1
it's ips from my isp not from my own dhcp server
Live or private IP's?
your sure bout that? usualy you get static when you buy live IP's
reason i am asking is usualy dynamic IPs are private. if your computers ip is 192. or 10. etc its none live, whats ifconfig show for ip? 1st 3 digits
the ISP cant see your mac addy, your router does
no its not, the ubuntu computer is plugged into a router
you have an ISP router someplace
what does ifconfig say on your PC ?
would you answer the question?
whats 1st 3 digits from ifconfig on eth0 on ubuntu box?
192 is NOT a live IP address is a private I address
oh, my bad, youve got the isp on eth1
dumb question but why do you need to change the IP its getting?
and like i said before, just static IP the machine to an address under or over the one it keeps being handed
theres a setting to change reported mac addy in my ubuntu install
